Dgame.Graphics.Font



struct Font;
Font is the low-level class for loading and manipulating character fonts. This class is meant to be used by Dgame.Graphics.Text.

Author:
rschuett

enum Style;
Font styles

Bold
Makes the text bold

Italic
Makes the text italic

Underline
Underline the text

Crossed
Cross the text

Normal
Normal text without any style.

enum Hint;
Font Hints

Normal
Normal (default) Hint

Light


Mono


None
No Hint

enum Mode;
Font mode

Solid
Solid mode is dirty but fast.

Shaded
Blended is optimized but still fast.

Blended
Nicest but slowest mode.

this(string filename, ubyte size, Mode mode = Mode.Solid, Style style = Style.Normal);
CTor

void opAssign(ref Font fnt);
opAssign

void opAssign(Font fnt);
Rvalue version

void free();
Close and release the current font and all which are linked to this Font.

void loadFromFile(string fontFile, ubyte fontSize = 0);
Load the font from a file. If the second parameter isn't 0, the current font size will be replaced with that. If both are 0, an exception is thrown.

const pure nothrow @property string filename();
Returns the current filename, if any

void setStyle(Style style);
Set the font style.

See:
Font.Style enum

const Style getStyle();
Returns the current font style.

See:
Font.Style enum

void setMode(Mode mode);
Set the font mode.

See:
Font.Mode enum

const pure nothrow Mode getMode();
Returns the current font mode.

See:
Font.Mode enum

void setHint(Hint hint);
Set a hint for the Font

See:
Hint enum

const pure nothrow Hint getHint();
Returns the current hint

const pure nothrow ubyte getSize();
Returns the current font size.

inout @property inout(TTF_Font)* ptr();
Returns a TTFthis.target pointer.

const pure nothrow int useCount();
Returns the current use count
